oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fannie Battle Social Workers, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo, published in the Nashville Times (1940), about the Fannie Battle Social Workers. The caption reads: “The Fannie Battle Social Workers are seen at a recent meeting at Centennial Club, where they planned the program of their work for the year. Left to right standing are: Mrs. John Donnelly, Mrs. Frank Wharton, Mrs. W. R. Manier, Jr., Mrs. George A. Ralston, Mrs. Robert T. Turner, Mrs. Thomas W. Estes, Mrs. William R. Maddux, Mrs. Austin W. Wilson, and Mrs. Fred Greve. Left to right seated are: Mrs. John Geny, Mrs. Charles H. Potter, president; Mrs. Charles Blackard, vice-president; Mrs. W. O. Vaughn, secretary; Mrs. David Huggins, treasurer, and Mrs. Clarence Taylor.” Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fannie Battle Social Workers; Fannie Battle Day Home
